column4: hi, i just successfully installed the ubuntu release, now in order to get my wireless card working in need the module prism2_cs, which is not installed, i tried installing linux-wlan-ng from synaptic but it didn't have the module either, do i need to compile the module myself ? if so what is the ubuntu-way of doing that ?
if someone could point me to a howto or in the right direction
its a compact flash card that sits in a smaller sized pcmcia slot, prism2
prism2_cs has worked for me under gentoo
radio you need pcmcia-cs package + wlan-ng module I think
yes pcmcia-cs is installed, also wlan-ng package, it is just the module thats missing
you could try to install host-ap :/
I think that also has drivers for prism2
yes it does, unfortunately prism2 does not work for me only prism2_cs does ;-)
did you try a find for the module? maybe it's placed incorrectly
yes i searched for it after installing, its not there
do you have a driver called wvlan-cs ?
